> The earlier comments explain why we don't think that solution is the best approach: for people distributing compiled packages, it requires that the people using those packages have GCC installed. This is not always the case on Windows systems.

Ah that makes some sense.  Since what you describe is not the common case, would it be reasonable to put something like this in as a temporary fix for 1.5 while the more complete fix is in the works?  It would at least resolve the issue for most people until the "proper" fix hits 1.6.
